text:
Thanks to Gen AI, anyone
can easily create art,
generate code, or even write a haiku.
And who doesn't love a haiku?

Generative AI is transforming
all types of industries,

but what makes Gen AI so
revolutionary and how does it work?

Like most artificial intelligence,
generative AI is powered

by machine learning
models, and Gen AI models

are commonly referred
to as foundation models.
Before foundation models came along,
traditional forms of machine learning
were primarily task specific.

For example, if you needed
to translate a paella recipe
from Spanish to English,

the model would only do
the translation work.

With Gen AI, you can not
only translate the recipe,
but you can go even further and create

an entirely new recipe
like a vegan paella,

if that's what you
prompted the model to do.

You can use Gen AI to create
new content of all kinds,

whether something simple
like writing custom captions

for images, or far more
complex like developing
more effective drug molecules.

The breakthrough for
foundation models came

with a neural network
architecture called transformer.

This technology entered
the conversation in 2017,
and is like the Swiss army knife of AI.
With transformer architecture,
there's no manual data preparation,

and because of the massive
amounts of pre-training,

AKA learning, the models can
be used for a wide variety
of generalized tasks.
This adaptability and ease of use

are really what makes
generative AI unique.
And as more people get access to Gen AI,
this technology has the potential

to transform our daily
lives for the better.

Helping to solve some of the
world's toughest challenges

in education, healthcare,
climate, and beyond.
